Swedish Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Swedish Ambassador Gives Reception 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Paul Beijer hosted a reception at the embassy here Monday on the occasion of the
birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Present on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Tang Su, general director of the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs, and others. Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Film Show Held at Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Film Show Held at Russian Embassy 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov hosted a film show at the embassy here Monday on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of the signing of the treaty of friendship, good neighborliness and cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
 Present on invitation were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairperson of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, university teachers and media persons here.
 They watched Russian feature film "A Special Unit."

articles.title: Public Presentation on Kim Jong Il's Greatness Held
Film Show for Foreign Diplomats Held
articles.content:
Film Show for Foreign Diplomats Held 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of Culture hosted a film show for officials in charge of cultural relations of foreign embassies here
at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Monday on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
. It was addressed by Jo Chan Gu, vice-minister of Culture, and Mahmoud Masoud Amer, first councilor of the People's Bureau of Libya. Its participants watched Korean feature film "Bouquet of Dandelion."
 At the end of the film show they talked to one another about the need to boost the cooperation and exchange in the fields of culture and art among countries, deepening the friendship.
